title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not explain why a power company would choose wind energy rather than energy from biomass to replace electricity generation by fossil fuels, such as any of the following:

· Producing electricity from biomass requires the construction of a powerplant, whereas wind turbines can be placed on farmland/any marginal land in the country.

· Producing electricity from biomass produces air pollution during combustion, whereas wind turbines do not produce air pollution during operation.

· Producing electricity from biomass requires the transportation of biomass to the power plant, whereas wind turbines do not require energy in transportation.

· Biomass fuel often comes from ethanol, which requires land to grow corn. The amount of land required to harvest corn is greater than the amount of land needed for wind turbines.
